title: Opinion on new 2024 rules for jumping distances

posts.author: RogueReroll
posts.content:
I've been thinking about distances lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about distances that came up in our game last night.

The rules for distances seem a bit ambiguous to me. On page 123 it states one thing, but then on page 145 it seems to contradict that. How do you interpret this?

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about distances?

posts.author: MonkeyBusinessDM
posts.content:
In our last session, we encountered a Beholder and tried to use Opinion to gain an advantage, but it didn't work out as planned.

For my next character, I want to focus on Opinion as a central feature. What subclasses or multiclass options would work best with this?

In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how Opinion works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

In my campaign, we had a situation with Opinion that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.

posts.author: SorcerousSally
posts.content:
The way I understand the rules for 2024, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that 2024 functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for 2024 are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

In my campaign, we had a situation with 2024 that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.
